method.text: Sift the flour into a bowl. Rub the butter in until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir in the sugar. Add enough milk to bind to a soft and pliable but not sticky dough.
Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth. Roll out to a rectangle 20 cm x 10cm. Spread the jam over the dough. Roll up lengthways like a Swiss roll. Cut into slices and set aside.
Place the apples, blackberries, water, sugar and cinnamon in a pan. Bring to the boil before simmering for 5-10 min, until the sugar has dissolved.
Transfer to a shallow ovenproof dish. Arrange the pastry rounds around the edge.
Place in the oven for 15 min until well risen and golden brown.
